{{Unreferenced|date=August 2007}} {{Infobox Election | election_name = United States Senate elections, 1894 | country = United States | flag_year = 1867 | type = legislative | ongoing = no | previous_election = United States Senate elections, 1892 | previous_year = 1892 | next_election = United States Senate elections, 1896 | next_year = 1896 | seats_for_election = ? seats in the [[United States Senate]] | election_date = November 1894 | image1 = | party1 = Republican Party (United States) | last_election1 = 40 seats | seats1 = 44 | seat_change1 = +4 | popular_vote1 = | percentage1 = | swing1 = | image2 = | party2 = Democratic Party (United States) | last_election2 = 44 seats | seats2 = 40 | seat_change2 = -4 | popular_vote2 = | percentage2 = | swing2 = | title = Majority Party | before_election = Democratic Party | after_election = Republican Party }}
[[Image:William Jennings Bryan 2.jpg|thumb|175px|[[William Jennings Bryan]] as a younger man.]] The '''U.S. Senate election, 1894''' was a slight [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] victory. It was in this election that future presidential candidate [[William Jennings Bryan]] failed to win a Senate seat in Nebraska. == Results == * Plurality: Republican: 42 * Minority: Democrats: 39 * Other parties: Populist: 4, Silver: 2 * Total: 88 * Vacant: 1, due to failure to elect. Later filled by a Democrat
== Change in Senate composition ==
